result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant called the Clerk of Court to let us know that he bailed out yesterday, and is wondering whether or not he still needs to appear for his bail reduction motion today at 11:30am.  Per JA in Br 1 he does not need to appear.  Hearing removed from calendar and defendant instructed to contact Atty Falk to let him know that the hearing is cancelled.

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant released from custody.

1:58 PM Defendant Ishtayopio Oke Jones in court.  In custody.   Attorney Jacalyn Labre for Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appearing by video for State of Wisconsin.   The PD's office is yet to appoint counsel to represent the Defendant in this matter.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits and reschedules preliminary examination.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Ishtayopio Oke Jones
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: 1219 Pine Avenue, Oconto, WI
Re:  PTC Possess methamphetamine, repeater, on 07-01-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine, possess schedule I or II narcotic, possess drug paraphernalia, possess other schedule drug and obstruct officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-05-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Raven Boyd and George Baxter and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.
